intro: Swertia lloydioides, commonly known as the Himalayan swertia, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom during the summer months. Swertia lloydioides is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its medicinal properties have been studied for potential use in traditional herbal remedies.
